alert.note: Alert for Grant; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 1:58PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST/11 PM MST/ TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM CST /2 PM MST/ WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Morton and Grant counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until Midnight CST/11 PM MST/ tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to Noon CST /11 AM MST/ Thursday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM CST /2 PM MST/ Wednesday to Noon CST /11 AM MST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel due to snow and blowing snow reducing visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
